title: Capstone Project in Collaboration with U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service
description: Processed 20,000+ fish videos for species identification and length measurement, achieving 94% accuracy and reducing manual analysis time by over 80%.
Built a scalable Django web application for concurrent processing of up to 100 videos with real-time updates via AJAX, enhancing user experience.

title: Associate Backend Developer
description: Lead Developer: Qelza - Work Management Solution
Spearheaded Qelza's back-end development (Django, scalable database) with a 5-developer team, ensuring on-time, on-budget delivery for Happi Mobiles.
Architected efficient GraphQL API schema for Qelza, boosting data querying/manipulation by 50% vs. prior REST API, for streamlined development and complex data interactions.

Implemented thorough code review processes to ensure code quality, adherence to best practices, and knowledge sharing among team members, resulting in a 40% decrease in bugs and improved overall code maintainability.
Deployed GitLab CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and deployment, and containerized the application using Docker for enhanced scalability, reducing deployment times by 30%.

Demonstrated effective project leadership by overseeing timelines, resource allocation, and collaboration, while also engaging with client stakeholders to understand and meet specific requirements. Implemented rigorous testing procedures, resulting in a 50% reduction in post-deployment issues.
Maintained comprehensive documentation for codebase and API specifications, contributing to a 25% increase in development team productivity.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Developed a highly accurate (~91%) tattoo detection and identification system using YOLO and PyTorch, demonstrating efficient object recognition capabilities.
Enhanced the tattoo detection system by developing a user-friendly Django API with secure OTP-based login, streamlining user experience.
Converted the dataset to Pascal VOC 2012 format, leveraging its structured annotation and organization advantages for improved model training and evaluation.

title: Deep Learning Engineer
description: Worked with one of India’s largest retail companies (Happi Mobiles), where I played a key role in designing and implementing robust deep learning algorithms. Engineered a YOLO-based deep learning algorithm with parallel processing, achieving ~95% accuracy in person detection, and realizing a speedup of 2.4 with an efficiency improvement to 30.30%.
Implemented triplet loss for face clustering, resulting in a 15% reduction in false positives and a 20% improvement in identification accuracy, ultimately achieving an 87% recognition rate.

Optimized and maintained an Airflow scheduler, automating and efficiently managing cron jobs, saving approximately 2 hours daily per engineer. This ensured seamless and timely operations of critical processes.

Played a pivotal role as a core researcher in topics related to Object detection and clustering. This contribution led to the successful launch of projects with 2 new clients and marked the company’s inaugural venture into in-house Advanced Camera Analytics.
